p: There were significant relationships between the distribution of insect attractive crops, field beans ( Vicia faba) and oilseed rape ( Brassica napus), and their presence within honey samples (Fig. 4). Vicia species were more likely to be detected in honey within a 2 km radius of field beans ( x 2 = 52.83, d.f. = 4, P < 0.001) and Brassica species within 2 km of oilseed rape ( x 2 = 50.71, d.f. = 4, P < 0.001).
